name: TB-500
overview: TB-500 is a synthetic version of the naturally occurring peptide Thymosin Beta-4. It is often discussed for its potential role in tissue repair and recovery, though robust human clinical evidence is sparse.
who_should_avoid: Those with active cancers or a history of cancer without oncologist approval
People with autoimmune conditions without medical supervision
interactions_notes: Interactions are poorly documented. Discuss all current medications and health conditions with a healthcare professional.
dosing_ranges_literature: Common protocols mention 2-5 mg per injection, typically 1-2 times weekly. Clinical dosing standards are not established.
storage_notes: Store lyophilized powder refrigerated. After reconstitution, use within recommended timeframe per supplier; refrigeration typically required.

references.title: Thymosin β4: Structure, Function, and Therapeutic Applications
references.note: Examines preclinical research on thymosin beta-4's role in wound healing and tissue repair.

references.title: Potential Therapeutic Uses of Thymosin Beta-4
references.note: Reviews potential applications; notes limited human trial data.
